title_sort: william stansberry to walt whitman, 9 december 1873
title: William Stansberry to Walt Whitman, 9 December 1873
text: Howard Lake,Wright Co.Minn.Dec 915 1873Mr. Walter WhitmanMy Dear Friend:After the laps[lapse] of over 2 years, & to let you know that your memory is yet fresh in my mind; I am moved mooved[moved] to write you this letter — I Came to this state after being discharged from the Army. My health is not good & has been since I was in the army—My family is well & childred going to school. Our chances & advantages of school has been limited very much until within the last 2 or 3 years—but is developing rapidly—our state has at present a large school fund—I often think of the Blackbery[Blackberry] Jam you gave me & all the kindness which youv[you've] shown me—I would love to write to the Doctor but have forgotten his name if you remember his name & address PlsPlease give them to me—I will not prolong this letter not knowing whether it will be received or not—I yet retain your Photograph with care—Hoping to hear from you soonI am very TrulyYour FriendWilliam Stansberry Walter Whitman Washington City, D.C. William Stansberry to Walt Whitman, 9 December 1873
